actor_awards.notes: Famous for starring in three Best Picture Oscar winners: 'The Bridge on the River Kwai', 'Ben-Hur', and 'Lawrence of Arabia'.

filmography.title: The Fallen Idol
filmography.role_description: A police detective investigating the accidental death of a butler's wife, viewed through the eyes of a young boy.
filmography.plot: A butler working in a foreign embassy in London falls under suspicion when his wife accidentally falls to her death.

filmography.title: The Small Back Room
filmography.role_description: A slick, self-serving bureaucrat who clashes with the scientist protagonist in this Powell & Pressburger drama.
filmography.plot: A scientist specializing in bomb disposal struggles with a back injury and alcohol while dealing with internal politics.

filmography.title: The Black Rose
filmography.role_description: A master archer and loyal companion who accompanies Tyrone Power's character on a journey to the Far East.
filmography.plot: A 13th-century Saxon nobleman travels to China to escape Norman rule and find his fortune.

filmography.title: The Elusive Pimpernel
filmography.role_description: The future King George IV, who is friends with Sir Percy Blakeney, the Scarlet Pimpernel.
filmography.plot: An English aristocrat leads a double life rescuing French nobles from the Reign of Terror.

filmography.title: No Highway in the Sky
filmography.role_description: An aircraft executive who must decide whether to believe a scientist's theory that a new plane design is fatally flawed.
filmography.plot: An aeronautical engineer predicts a new type of plane will fail after a specific number of hours due to metal fatigue.

filmography.title: Mandy
filmography.role_description: The headmaster of a school for the deaf who helps a young girl learn to communicate, creating tension with her parents.
filmography.plot: The parents of a deaf girl struggle to find the best way to raise and educate her, leading to marital conflict.
filmography.awards: Venice Film Festival: Special Jury Prize

filmography.title: The Cruel Sea
filmography.role_description: A dedicated Royal Navy corvette commander who must make agonizing life-or-death decisions during the Battle of the Atlantic.
filmography.plot: The crew of the HMS Compass Rose face the dangers of German U-boats and the unforgiving sea during World War II.

filmography.title: The Malta Story
filmography.role_description: The commanding officer overseeing the desperate aerial defense of Malta during WWII.
filmography.plot: A British reconnaissance pilot and the island's defenders fight to survive the siege of Malta during World War II.

filmography.title: The Intruder
filmography.role_description: An ex-colonel who returns home to find a burglar, whom he recognizes as a former soldier under his command.
filmography.plot: A former army officer decides to help a young burglar he commanded during the war instead of turning him in.

filmography.title: Land of the Pharaohs
filmography.role_description: The obsessed Egyptian pharaoh who devotes his life and kingdom to building an impregnable pyramid for his afterlife.
filmography.plot: Pharaoh Khufu commands the construction of the Great Pyramid of Giza to secure his treasure for the afterlife.

filmography.title: The Prisoner
filmography.role_description: A state official in a totalitarian country who engages in a psychological battle of wills with an imprisoned Cardinal.
filmography.plot: A Cardinal is imprisoned and interrogated by the state in an attempt to force a false confession of treason.

filmography.title: The Bridge on the River Kwai
filmography.role_description: A tough British commando leader who commands the mission to destroy the bridge built by POWs.
filmography.plot: British POWs are forced to build a railway bridge across the river Kwai for their Japanese captors, not knowing that the allied forces are planning to destroy it.

filmography.title: Gideon's Day
filmography.role_description: A harried Scotland Yard inspector trying to juggle multiple crimes and his family life in a single day.
filmography.plot: A typical day in the life of a Scotland Yard inspector involves bribery, robbery, and murder.

filmography.title: The Two-Headed Spy
filmography.role_description: A British agent who has operated deep undercover as a Nazi general in the German High Command since WWI.
filmography.plot: A British spy poses as a Nazi general during World War II to feed information back to the Allies.

filmography.title: Ben-Hur
filmography.role_description: A Roman consul who adopts Judah Ben-Hur after the slave saves his life during a sea battle.
filmography.plot: After a Jewish prince is betrayed and sent to slavery by a Roman friend, he regains his freedom and returns for revenge.

filmography.title: The League of Gentlemen
filmography.role_description: A disgruntled, forced-to-retire Lt. Colonel who recruits a squad of disgraced ex-army officers to pull off a bank heist.
filmography.plot: A group of embittered ex-army officers are recruited by a former colonel to rob a bank using military precision.
filmography.awards: San Sebastian Film Festival: Win – Best Actor

filmography.title: Five Finger Exercise
filmography.role_description: A newly rich but uncultured father who clashes with his pretentious wife and sensitive son.
filmography.plot: A German tutor arrives at the summer home of a wealthy British family, exposing the fault lines in their relationships.

filmography.title: Lawrence of Arabia
filmography.role_description: The pragmatic British general who recognizes Lawrence's potential and manipulates his actions for the war effort.
filmography.plot: The story of T.E. Lawrence, the English officer who successfully united and led the diverse, often warring, Arab tribes during World War I.

filmography.title: Zulu
filmography.role_description: A pacifist Swedish missionary who tries to convince the British soldiers to abandon Rorke's Drift before the Zulu attack.
filmography.plot: Outnumbered British soldiers do battle with 4,000 Zulu warriors at the Battle of Rorke's Drift in 1879.
filmography.awards: BAFTA: Nomination – Best British Art Direction

filmography.title: Guns at Batasi
filmography.role_description: A British colonel in post-colonial Africa who must deal with a coup, representing the fading Empire.
filmography.plot: A British Regimental Sergeant Major stationed in Africa finds himself in a difficult position when a coup d'état occurs.

filmography.title: Lord Jim
filmography.role_description: The sea captain who narrates the story and tries to understand the tragic fate of the title character.
filmography.plot: After being discredited as a coward, a 19th-century seaman lives for only one purpose: to redeem himself.

filmography.title: Masquerade
filmography.role_description: A British agent assigned to protect the young heir to an oil-rich Middle Eastern kingdom.
filmography.plot: British agents are assigned to guard the young heir to an oil-rich Arab nation to prevent a coup.

filmography.title: Oh! What a Lovely War
filmography.role_description: The Austrian Emperor portrayed in this satirical musical about World War I; one of his dubbed roles.
filmography.plot: A musical satire of World War I, chronicling the war through the members of one British family.

filmography.title: Waterloo
filmography.role_description: A tough British general who fights at Waterloo despite being injured and wearing civilian clothes.
filmography.plot: Facing the decline of everything he has worked to obtain, Napoleon Bonaparte and his army confront the British at the Battle of Waterloo.

filmography.title: Theatre of Blood
filmography.role_description: A theater critic who becomes a victim of Vincent Price's vengeful Shakespearean actor; Hawkins' voice was dubbed.
filmography.plot: A Shakespearean actor takes poetic revenge on the critics who denied him recognition.
